job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.description:
About Binti
Binti’s mission is to increase equality of opportunity and help every person have a fair chance at life. With over 400,000 youth in foster care in the United States, we are reinventing child welfare through technology to help every child find a safe, loving, and stable family. We partner with state, county, and private foster care agencies around the country, helping them recruit and approve foster parents more quickly and empowering social workers by eliminating administrative paperwork. Our software also helps match families with children and helps track services to biological families to get on their feet and reunify with their children. Binti currently works with over 140 foster care agencies across 22 states. Rhode Island, New Mexico, Hawaii, and Washington have signed on to make our software their statewide solution.
Our goal is to be the end-to-end modular child welfare data system solution. Our Approvals and Placements modules are widely used and have significantly improved outcomes. Agencies working with us have approved 80% more families on average in their first year of using Binti, with a 16% reduction in time to approve and 20-40% savings in social worker time. Our Case Management module is completing a pilot with our existing agencies and will be more widely available very soon. We are also expanding our team to further develop 3 additional modules.
Binti is a mission-driven software company based in Oakland, CA. We have raised our Series A led by Founders Fund and other investors include First Round Capital and Kapor Capital.
The role
The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, multi-tasker, and demonstrated team-player. You will be a lead developer responsible for the development of new software products and enhancements to existing products. You should excel in working with large-scale applications and frameworks and have outstanding communication and leadership skills.
Binti currently has three modules - Approvals, Placements & Case Management. Our product is built on Ruby on Rails and React, backed by a Postgres database, hosted on Google Cloud, and orchestrated with Kubernetes.
Location
This role is open to candidates in the San Francisco Bay Area (our office is in Oakland - and you would have the option to work from the office when it is safe to do so), or fully remote candidates who are open to working core engineering hours (10:00 am - 4:00 pm PT) for real-time collaboration with the team.
Responsibilities
Help architect both our frontend and backend to be flexible, scalable, and approachable to other engineers
Help our team move quickly and learn while maintaining a welcoming and supportive culture
Push our product so it continues to be a beautiful, yet intuitive and accessible interface for users from all walks of life
Identify patterns and approaches within our code that’ll allow it to be simplified and improved
Build internal tools to help our technical account executive team build-out, among other things, complex custom forms, including versioning and data migration tools
Maintain HIPAA compliance for sensitive data that is shared with us
Experience & Skills
At least 4 years of professional software engineering experience
A self-motivated, experienced engineer who enjoys owning projects from inception to completion
Comfortable delving into the full stack
End-to-end experience building, shipping, and maintaining products
Having a growth mindset, having a sense of urgency, and being comfortable with challenging the status quo
Experience coaching and mentoring colleagues to level up as a team
Track record of breaking through walls on your way to success
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Perks & Benefits
An above market compensation package (Base + Equity)
Excellent medical, dental vision, and life insurance benefits
Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work-life blend, targeting 20 days/year
12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave for the arrival of a newborn or newly placed infant
11 Federally observed holidays including Juneteenth + Election Day
Sick/Mental Health time separate from vacation days (72 hours)
4 weeks of sabbatical after 4 years of service at the company
Paid Jury Duty
Option to allocate pre-tax dollars to 401K, commuter benefits, FSA, and DCSA with administration paid for
Monthly work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment (up to $100)
Focus on learning and development, with opportunities to attend trainings/conferences, on-site speaker series, and lunch and learns
At Binti, we celebrate having a diverse team and believe our differences make us stronger. Binti is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.
